title: TOI
content:
The U.S. dollar continues to dominate global markets but faces growing challenges from the Indian rupee. According to CareEdge Ratings, de-dollarization is a gradual process, with India taking steps to internationalize the rupee through currency swaps and global payment integrations. Despite hurdles like convertibility limits, the rupee’s international use is increasing. This shift points to a more multipolar global financial system, with emerging currencies gaining influence alongside the dollar. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh delivered a firm message at the UN TCC Chiefs’ Conclave, warning against nations that are openly violating international rules to shape a new world order. Reaffirming India’s faith in fairness, he called for protecting a rules-based international system. He urged powerful nations to step up their peacekeeping roles, highlighted India’s 75-year contribution to UN missions, and reminded the world that for India, peacekeeping is not a choice but a commitment.
